newsitem.title: USA: Informix faces another class action suit.
newsitem.headline: Informix faces another class action suit.

text.p: The law firm of Wolf Popper LLP said on Thursday it filed a purported class-action lawsuit against Informix Corp, claiming the company made misleading statements about its revenue.
Informix officials were not immediately available for comment.
The suit also alleges that certain Informix officers and directors sold about 960,000 shares of common stock when they knew of adverse facts that when revealed would hurt the stock's price.
The suit was filed on behalf of people who bought Informix stock between April 16, 1996, and March 31, 1997.
Informix on Thursday reported a first-quarter loss of $140.1 million, or $0.93 per share, compared with a net profit of $15.9 million, or $0.10 per share, for the same period the year before.
